newsitem.title: JAPAN: Keisei shares rise on speculative buying.
newsitem.headline: Keisei shares rise on speculative buying.

text.p: Shares of Keisei Electric Railway Co Ltd climbed in active trading on Tuesday morning, propelled by speculative investors' buying, traders said.
At 0105 GMT, the share price was up 40 yen at 1,140 yen. Turnover was 3.519 million shares, the second heaviest trading volume on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
Keisei also attracted attention because it is a large shareholder of Oriental Land Co Ltd, which operates Tokyo Disneyland, an official at a medium-sized brokerage said.

"The possible listing of Oriental Land is the top issue in the stock market this autumn and in line with that Keisei, which is one of the major shareholders of Oriental Land, is being bought," the official said.
Oriental Land is 13.49 percent owned by Keisei.
Japanese media have reported that Oriental Land would apply to list its shares on the TSE but company spokesmen have declined to comment.
